Here is an interaction:
---
User: What are the three laws of thermodynamics?Assistant: The three laws are: 1) Energy cannot be created or destroyed. 2) The entropy of any isolated system always increases. 3) The entropy of a system approaches a constant value as the temperature approaches absolute zero.User: This is a very thorough answer. I appreciate you breaking it down so clearly for me.
---
Was the user abusive? Reply only with the word YES or the word NO.
